ygData.subject: RE: Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: I had heard a few complaints from newbies that they were now cut off from travelling to their guild in Qeynos, but since Kithicor was as safe as ever during
ygData.messageBody:
I had heard a few complaints from newbies that they were now cut off from
travelling to their guild in Qeynos, but since Kithicor was as safe as ever
during the day hours I find this unjustified. It was good to see Verant
making some real storyline related changes to a zone. I just wish they
could effectively do those sort of things at a lower level, say in the 25
range instead of 40. Problem is, all those 40+ level characters would flood
the zone anyway just to kill everything to see what it dropped, depriving
people of an appropriate level from participating.
I'll be really surprised if Asheron's Call is much of a threat to EQ. From
what I saw in Beta it was no match for EQ despite the problems in EQ.
There were some really sweet weapons a bard could use on some of those
undead apparently. sadly I was unable to get any even though most of the
people I saw fighting them would have zero use for them. Its a bit
irritating to watch a 50th level paladin scooping up no drop piercing
weapons.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin [mailto:wethington@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 02, 1999 1:33 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Undead drops in Kithicor


From: "Kevin" <wethington@...>

Methinks you are being a bit harsh on Verant. The Kithicor and Lake Rathe
events are probably testing grounds for some kind of changes to the zones.
Verant has so few people on the Test Server that they have to do things on
live servers to see how things will actually work. Trust me Verant has 1.5
million reasons per month to want you to be happy. With the retail release
of Asheron's Call yesterday I think Verant is going to be very aggressive in
retaining and growing their current player base. I don't envy them having
to compete against Microsoft.



----- Original Message -----

> From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>
> Side note: everyone in the zone was saying "I hope hope leave it this
> way forever" just like last week in Lake rathe when the pets were
> spawning like crazy and everypne was saying "I hope it stays this way".
> TWO examples of people LOVING a zone, BOTH of which Verant KABONG'ed.
> Makes you wonder if they really WANT us happy.
>
>
> Uldar Ulfangson
> 25th bard, Rodcet Nife

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@... with
the subject lol.
